.  Its attractions include pleasant mountain recreation and world-caliber horse racing.  During the summer population triples as New Mexicans and Texans arrive to enjoy the horse races, gambling, and cool mountain air.

content=The White Mountain Wilderness is right next to Ruidoso and contains opportunities for all outdoor activities.  However, due to severe fire danger there are often restrictions or closures during the summer, the current restrictions should be checked before planning activities in the forest.
directions=One block off Sudderth by the river, behind Cafe Rio
content=This is a desserts only restaurant with exquisite offerings including cakes, cookies, mousses, Gelato (Italian Ice Cream) and more. Great service and lovely ambiance. Not to be missed.
content=Upscale rustic knotty pine cabins nestled amid the tall trees of Ruidoso's Upper Canyon. Amenities include full kitchen, washer/dryer, fireplace, hot tub, and deck views of Sierra Blanca.

content=Describes itself as "a Bed & Breakfast retreat for single adults or couples." All rooms non-smoking.
